name: Out of the Dark That Covers Me. . . Online Trivia | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the first verse of the Bible to use the word "dark" in the KJV? The word "darkness" doesn't count.
questions.explanation:
Genesis 15:17.

	It says in Genesis 15:17, "And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces." This is the chapter in which God makes a covenant with Abram, later known as Abraham.

questions.text: In Leviticus 13:6, what is the disease that "dark" is referring to?
questions.explanation:
Leprosy.

	Leprosy is a chronic disease caused by bacteria. It affects the nerves and the upper respiratory tract as well as the skin. In many countries leprosy is no longer found, however, in India and many third world countries leprosy continues to be an epidemic. About 95% of the people in the world are naturally immune to it. Despite medical advancement many people are still forced to live in leper colonies as this disease continues to cause fear in people. (Wikipedia)

questions.text: Who is the "him" referred to in Numbers 12:8, which says, "with 'him' I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in dark speeches..."?
questions.explanation:
Moses.

	This is the part of the book where Miriam, Moses' sister, becomes leprous because she and Aaron spoke against Moses.

questions.text: Who is said to have left when it was dark in Joshua 2:5?
questions.explanation:
Two spies.

	A woman named Rahab helped these Israelite spies. She hid them on her roof and they later repaid her by sparing her family when their army entered Jericho.

questions.text: How many verses in the book of Job contain the word "dark" in the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Five.

	Job is the book of the Bible that deals with patience. The following verses contain the word "dark": Job 3:9, Job 12:25, Job 18:6, Job 22:13 and Job 24:16.

questions.text: How does Psalm 74:20 (KJV) describe the "dark places of the earth"?
questions.correct: full of the habitations of cruelty
questions.explanation:
full of the habitations of cruelty.

	The "dark places" likely refer to lands where God is not worshipped. The writer urges "respect unto the covenant".

questions.text: What does Luke 11:36 (KJV) say should have "no part dark"?
questions.explanation:
the whole body.

	It says in Luke 11:36, "If thy whole body therefore be full of light, having no part dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shining of a candle doth give thee light." Being "no part dark" means not having any evil inside of one. Christ is often compared to light and Christians are told to carry the light.

questions.text: To where was the boat in John 6:17 sailing when it was dark?
questions.explanation:
Capernaum.

	Capernaum means village of Nahum. It was chosen as Jesus' base when he began his ministry. The boat mentioned in John 6:17 contained the disciples.

questions.text: Who first arrived at Jesus' empty tomb while it was still dark?
questions.explanation:
Mary Magdalene.

	It says in John 20:1, "The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre." Mary Magdalene was one of Jesus' biggest followers while he was here on Earth. It has traditionally been believed that she was a prostitute before turning her life over to Christ.

questions.text: What is the last verse of the Bible to use the word dark in the KJV?
questions.explanation:
II Peter 1:19.

	It says in II Peter 1:19, "We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts."
